intro: Epitrachys leucocephala, commonly known as the white-headed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and white or pale flowers. The plant relies on its host for water and nutrients, while it provides shelter and food for various insects and birds. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ecological role is significant in supporting biodiversity within forest ecosystems.
